channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump fires CDC head after one month on the job. Her lawyers say she ‘refused to rubber-stamp unscientific, reckless directives’
item.description: Susan Monarez's departure coincided with the resignations this week of at least four top CDC officials.

item.title: YouTube TV reaches ‘short-term extension’ to keep Fox channels on platform
item.description: In a statement earlier Wednesday, Fox said that it was “disappointed that Google continually exploits its outsized influence."

item.title: A Casualty of Trump’s Tariffs: India’s Nascent Solar Industry
item.description: The full weight of a 50 percent tariff on Indian goods took effect this week, undercutting one of the country’s most promising markets for solar expor...

item.title: A Traumatized Minneapolis Confronts Another Tragedy
item.description: The shooting of children at a Roman Catholic church came after a string of violent confrontations, going back to George Floyd, that has left the Twin ...

item.title: New Jersey town sues American Dream Mall for selling clothes on Sunday under ‘blue law’ that dates back centuries
item.description: Paramus boasts three large malls and miles of strip malls, but officials say nearly every other retail store in the county is closed to shoppers on Su...

item.title: Target still facing boycott from pro-DEI activists: ‘Leadership change doesn’t mean anything without a culture change’
item.description: The number of Americans who say they regularly shop at Target has gone down 19% since 2021, according to GWI, with Democrats the majority.

item.title: Exclusive: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz on $290 million acquisition of startup Onum and security in the AI age
item.description: The cybersecurity company, which went public in 2019, is a longtime acquirer, and has acquired data observability startup Onum for about $290 million.

item.title: CDC Director Susan Monarez Is Fired, White House Says
item.description: Susan Monarez was said to have refused to adopt Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s stance on vaccination policy.

item.title: Minneapolis Shooting Suspect Knew Her Target, but Motive Is a Mystery
item.description: The shooter who attacked a Catholic school on Wednesday posted social media videos and writings that betrayed a litany of grievances and obsessions.

item.title: Trump and Advisers, Including Kushner, Meet on Gaza’s Future
item.description: The meeting focused on the postwar future of the Gaza Strip, where Mr. Trump has mused about removing Palestinian residents and setting up a luxury re...

item.title: What to Know About Jimmy Lai’s Trial in Hong Kong
item.description: The media tycoon, jailed since 2020, ran a now-defunct newspaper that was critical of the government.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Freedom May Now Hinge on Beijing and Trump
item.description: As the outspoken Hong Kong publisher awaits a verdict, his trial has become a test of China’s resolve to crush dissent, and of whether President Trump...

item.title: Germany Proposes Plan to Boost Recruitment or Resort to Draft
item.description: Some detractors think the new bill is too weak to fill the recruitment gap. Others worry it will inevitably lead to forced conscription.

item.title: After Blocking U.N. Nuclear Watchdog, Iran Allows Inspectors to Return
item.description: Iran halted cooperation with the agency last month, as experts warned that Tehran might revive efforts to build a nuclear bomb.

item.title: Denmark Summons U.S. Envoy Over Greenland Espionage Allegations
item.description: It was the latest twist in a simmering diplomatic conflict over Greenland. President Trump wants the island to be a U.S. territory, but Denmark refuse...
